habitat_description: Found in the karst limestone topography of the Salem and Springfield plateaus of the Ozark Uplift in Missouri, Arkansas, and Kansas, this species (formerly included in the genus Typhlotriton [species spelaeus]) inhabits sand or gravel bed stream-fed caves and springs with clear water lacking siltation. Adults and larvae may be found deep within cave pools but larvae are occasionally found in streams outside caves (Brandon 1971, Hendricks and Kezer 1958, Dunn 1926, Petranka 1998). This species was attributed to the genus Eurycea by Bonett and Chippindale (2004) based on genetic examination of the E. multiplicata complex.
